intro: Cinchona academica, commonly known as the Peruvian bark, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, clustered white flowers. It is closely related to the genus Cinchona, which is the source of quinine, a compound used in malaria treatment. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
